'''Pachirisu''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''パチリス''' ''Pachirisu'') is an {{type|Electric}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation IV]].

It is not known to [[Evolution|evolve]] into or from any other Pokémon.

==Biology==
Pachirisu is a small, white squirrel-like Pokémon with a faint blueish tint and a light blue stripe starting from its forehead and goes all the way down to the tip of the tail. A female Pachirisu's blue stripe is shorter than a male's. A large white tooth grows out of its mouth. It has deep gray eyes and a yellow circle on each cheek. Its tail is almost twice as big as its body, with three spikes at the top of the curl, which it can use to shoot charges. Though its arms and legs are very short, it can run incredibly fast, enabling it to tire pursuing Pokémon out quickly. It has a great amount of electricity flowing in its body. If it builds up enough charge, it may shock other Pokémon.

When it sleeps, Pachirisu likes to curl its big, fluffy tail round to the front of its body and uses it as a pillow. It also likes to chase and groom its tail. When a Pachirisu sheds its fur it shapes them into furballs, which have static charges just like its fur. It hides its favorite {{pkmn|food}}s—which mainly consist of berries—in these static puffs and stores them in tree holes. It does this to protect the food; if a human or another Pokémon tries to take the food, they will get shocked from the static. It may rub cheek pouches with another Pachirisu to share stored electricity. It is generally found in tree tops in forests, as well as the outskirts of a forest and near power plants.

==In the anime==
[[File:Dawn Pachirisu.png|thumb|left|250px|Pachirisu in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Dawn's Pachirisu]]====
{{an|Dawn}} has a Pachirisu, which debuted in ''[[DP019|Twice Smitten, Once Shy!]]''.

====Other====
A Pachirisu appeared in ''[[XY035|The Forest Champion!]]'', where it was gathering food along with a {{p|Patrat}} and {{p|Sentret}}, only to be scared off by an {{p|Ursaring}}. However, they were saved thanks to the forest champion {{AP|Hawlucha}}.

===Minor appearances===
A Pachirisu appeared in ''[[PK24|Meloetta's Moonlight Serenade]]''.

A Pachirisu appeared in ''[[XY048|A Campus Reunion!]]''.

Multiple Pachirisu appeared in ''[[XY062|The Future Is Now, Thanks to Determination!]]'', where they were among the {{type|Electric}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} being controlled by {{TRT}}.

A Pachirisu appeared in ''[[XY073|A Fashionable Battle!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Pachirisu appeared in ''[[XY096|A Giga Battle with Mega Results!]]''.

A Pachirisu appeared in ''[[XY105|Party Dancecapades!]]'', under the ownership of a [[Pokémon Performer]] attending [[Monsieur Pierre]]'s dance party.

Four Pachirisu appeared in ''[[XY119|A Full-Strength Battle Surprise!]]''.

A Trainer's Pachirisu appeared in ''[[XY125|A League of His Own!]]''.

A wild Pachirisu appeared during a flashback in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]'', where it was one of the Pokémon seen at [[Nebel Plateau]].

A Trainer's Pachirisu appeared in ''[[XY137|Battling With a Clean Slate!]]''.

Two Pachirisu appeared in ''[[XY140|Till We Compete Again!]]'', each under the ownership of a different Trainer.

==In the manga==
[[File:Platinum Pachirisu.png|thumb|125px|Pachirisu in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Pachirisu was silhouetted in ''[[PS338|Stagestruck Starly]]''.

Pachirisu made its debut in ''[[PS351|Perturbed by Pachirisu]]'', where one was used to disorganize {{adv|Platinum}}'s [[Fashion Case]] in an attempt to sabotage her [[Pokémon Super Contest|Super Contest]] challenge.

A Trainer's Pachirisu appeared in ''[[PS361|Bombastic Bibarel & Heroic Hippopotas]]''.

In ''[[PS413|Double Trouble with Dialga and Palkia III]]'', {{adv|Platinum}} was given her own Pachirisu by [[Volkner]], courtesy of [[Maylene]].

A Trainer's Pachirisu appeared in ''[[PS418|Deprogramming Porygon-Z]]''.

In ''[[PAXY10|Pangoro Poses a Problem]]'' multiple Pachirisu were among the {{type|electric}} Pokémon that charges the [[Prism Tower]] during a blackout.

===In the Pokémon Diamond and Pearl Adventure! manga===
A Trainer's Pachirisu appeared in ''[[DPA06|Beauty Contest: The Pokémon Super Contest!!]]'', participating in a [[Pokémon Super Contest]].

Multiple Pachirisu appeared in a flashback in ''[[DPAS1|Deoxys, The Phantom Pokémon! (Part 1)]]''.

===In the Darkrai Mission Story: Pokémon Ranger Vatonage - the Comic manga===
In the [[Darkrai Mission Story: Pokémon Ranger Vatonage - the Comic|Pokémon Ranger: Shadows of Almia manga]], both [[Kellyn]] and {{OBP|Kate|Ranger}} use a Pachirisu as their partner.

==Trivia==
[[File:PBRTaylor.png|thumb|100px|Taylor's Pachirisu costume]]
* In Pokémon Battle Revolution, [[Colosseum Leader Taylor]] wears a Pachirisu costume.
* Pachirisu is the only Pokémon allowed in [[Amity Square]] that does not have an evolutionary family.
* Pachirisu has the lowest base stat total of any Pokémon that was part of the winning team of a Pokémon World Championship.

===Origin===
Pachirisu is based on a {{wp|squirrel}}. The spikes on its tail (and possibly its ears) could be a reference to {{wp|static electricity}}'s impact on hair.

====Name origin====
Pachirisu is a combination of パチパチ ''pachipachi'' (electric crackling) and 栗鼠 ''risu'' (squirrel).
